info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:54AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 PM EDT... At 1154 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Felicity, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Augusta, Felicity, Decatur, Russellville, Higginsport, Chilo, Redoak and Feesburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
